result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexandra J Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Upon successful completion of probation and no new violations rising to the level of probable cause.

-Absolute sboriety.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

Defendant to pay the retail amount for a box of Suboxone. DOC agent to obtain the price of a box of Suboxone from 2 local pharmacies and average the price. Defendant agrees to pay this amount for restitution. 
The restitution amount will then need an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $50/month to begin 5/1/17 and due the first of the month thereafter. Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
